chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Kegler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Anthony  Kegler in court with attorney Caroline Ann Carver.  Defendant Anthony  Kegler in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 16CF62, 16CF160, 16CF188, and 17CF44 @ 3:03 p.m. Agreement stated - Waivers and arraignments done ins 2016 cases. State moves to dri all of 17CF44, 16CF188, 16CF160 cts 3 & 4, and 16CF62 cts 3 & 4. Def will plead to 16CF62 cts 1 & 2, and 16CF160 cts 1 & 2.  PSI requested. State agrees to cap recommendation to 4 ic, 4es, Def free to argue. Off the record briefly. State advises now - Joint recommendation for  6 yrs prison, 2 yrs ic, 4 yrs es, as controlling sentence.  16CF160 ct 1 - 9 mo jail, ct 2 - 6 yrs prison, 2 yrs ic, 4 yrs es, concurrent to ct 1.  16CF62 - ct 1 - 3 1/2 yrs prison, 18 mo ic, 2 yrs es, concurrent to any other sentence. Ct 2 - 18 mo ic, 2 yrs es, concurrent to any other sentence. Atty Carver agrees. Def understands and agrees. Plea quest. reviewed. 16CF62 ct 1 - no contest plea. Ct 2 - no contest plea. 16CF160 ct 1 - no contest plea. Ct 2 - no contest plea. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in 16CF62 cts 3 & 4, 16CF160 cts 3 & 4, 16CF188 cts 1 & 2, 17CF44 all 5 cts. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties. Court advises maximum jail on 16CF160 ct 1 is 30 days. Atty Carver satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds Def guilty of 16CF62 cts 1 & 2, and 16CF160 cts 1 & 2. Sentencing remarks by State. State advises that Def has sentence credit of 350 days in 17CF44, 2 days in 16CF160 and 6 days in 16CF62. State believes that means total credit in 16CF62 is 356 days and 16CF160 is 352 days. State has complied with VWNR. 16CF160 restitution was requested for $2467.10. Def may request restitution hrg. No restitution requested in other cases. Court questions if there is co-defendant. State advises no co-defendants in 16CF160. Court asks Def's position on restitution. Atty Carver asks for copy of restitution statement and reserves right for hearing. Defense questions credit on 16CF160. Off the record 3:31. Back on the record 3:35. Sentencing remarks by Atty Carver. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court. Will follow agreement. Orders on 16CF62 ct 1 - 3 1/2 yrs prison, 1 1/2 yrs ic, 2 yrs es, court costs, DNA sample if not on file, DNA surcharge, credit for 356 days served. Ct 2 - 3 1/2 yrs prison, 1 1/2 yrs ic, 2 yrs es, concurrent, court costs, DNA sample if not on file, DNA surcharge waived, credit for 356 days served. Bond applied to restitution.
16CF160 ct 1 - 30 days jail, court costs, DNA surcharge waived, DNA sample if not on file, credit for 406 days served. Ct 2 - 6 yrs prison, 2 yrs ic, 4 yrs es, concurrent to ct 1 - all cts are concurrent, credit for 406 days, court costs, DNA surcharge. Restitution $2467.10. Def may request hrg within 60 days if disputes. Bonds in both files can be applied to restitution after 60 days if not disputed or when finalized. Def is eligible for CIP and SAP. Def advised of firearms and voting restrictions. Postconviction rights. Court costs in 16CF160 ct 1 to be collected on extended supervision. Ct 1 jail sentence is complete.

Defendant Anthony  Kegler in court with attorney Paul M Goetz.  Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls 16CF62, 16CF160 & 16CF188 @ 9:34 am. 16CF62 Waiver was already held and information already filed.  16CF160 & 16CF188 - Waiver of Preliminary Examination Filed.  Atty Goetz agrees with waiver.  Atty Goetz does not have copy of information on 16CF62.  Court will have COC give def. copy.  Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause and binds over.  Informations filed.  Atty Goetz has copy of informations on both cases, waives reading and enters Not Guilty on all ct's in both files. Court receives Not Guilty to all ct's in both files.  Atty Goetz reserve jurisdiction rights.  Status conference scheduled for March 13, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Court receives Not Guilty to all ct's in both files.  Atty Goetz reserve jurisdiction rights.  Status conference scheduled for March 13, 2017 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays in court.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 11:21 am.  Def. has pending case in 16CF160 & 16CF188 which have outstanding warrants.  State would like to be set for status cnf. Court will only set this case for Status Cnf.  Status conference scheduled for November 28, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
of Preliminary Examination

Defendant Anthony Kegler in court with attorney Tina M. Abernethy-Mays.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called @ 3:50 p.m. Waiver of prelim filed. Court reviews with Def. Court finds waiver knowing and voluntary, finds probable cause and binds over. Information filed. Copy received, reading waived, reserve all juris. objections, not guilty pleas. Court receives not guilty pleas to all 4 counts and directs entry in record. Off the record for scheduling. Back on the record. Status conf set. Bond continues. Atty Abernethy-Mays addresses bond, asks no contact conditions with B.S. and J. S. be lifted. State does not object. Court lifts no contact as to B.S. and J.S. only. COC to send copy of minutes to Sheriff's Dept.  Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony Kegler in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint received, reviewed and waive reading.  Time limits for preliminary waived.  New counsel will be appointed.  Timely preliminary hearing explained.  Def waives time limits.  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
